newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco to spend $370 mln on public wage rise.
newsitem.headline: Morocco to spend $370 mln on public wage rise.

text.p: Morocco will devote 3.2 billion dirhams ($370 million) to pay rises and social benefits for public sector employees following an agreement between the government and unions, the interior ministry said on Saturday.

"After a recent meeting between unions and the Interior Minister Driss Basri, the government agreed to devote an envelope of 3.220 billion dirhams for wage increases and other social benefits in favour of civil servants," an official at the interior ministry said.
Morocco has an estimated 500,000 civil servants including members of the army and security forces.
The latest accord follows a government-trade union agreement reached in August under which wages were to be increased in the public and private sectors and social disputes resolved through dialogue.
Last week the government announced a 10 percent increase in the minimum wage to 7.98 dirhams per hour in industry, trade and private business.
It also set a minimum wage of 41.36 dirhams per day in the agricultural sector.
The average minimum wage in the private sector was around 1,500 dirhams per month before the increase.
Morocco's workforce is estimated at 10 million, of which 50 percent is in rural areas.
